cards.name: Act of Treason
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Each day uncertainty and rumors spread, and each night attendance at the Juri Revue increases.

cards.name: Adaptive Snapjaw
cards.text: Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
cards.flavor:
"Eh, needs more toad."
—Gulistan, Simic biomancer

cards.name: Aerial Maneuver
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying and first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"When you put all of yourself into an attack, without fear or hesitation, in that instant you may attain greatness."
—Predak, Gateless freemage

cards.name: Ætherize
cards.text: Return all attacking creatures to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "You can come back once you've learned some manners—and figured out how to reconstitute your physical forms."

cards.name: Agoraphobia
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -5/-0.
{2}{U}: Return Agoraphobia to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "Everyone in this city is choosing sides. I choose inside."

cards.name: Alms Beast
cards.text: Creatures blocking or blocked by Alms Beast have lifelink.
cards.flavor: Alms-coins are only redeemable at Orzhov businesses.

cards.name: Alpha Authority
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has hexproof and can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: Even the bitterest enemies of the Burning-Tree Clan respect the strength of Borborygmos's rule.

cards.name: Angelic Edict
cards.text: Exile target creature or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The Boros built a prison in the sky where Azorius statutes couldn't restrict their sense of justice.

cards.name: Angelic Skirmisher
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each combat, choose first strike, vigilance, or lifelink. Creatures you control gain that ability until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "A keen mind wields an army as a deft hand wields a sword."

cards.name: Armored Transport
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Armored Transport by creatures blocking it.
cards.flavor:
"If only our jails were as secure."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

cards.name: Arrows of Justice
cards.text: Arrows of Justice deals 4 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Archers from the Horizon Military Academy hone their skills by targeting pickpockets blocks away.

cards.name: Assault Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"The Simic offer a prize to any biomancer who can breed a krasis to match a griffin in the air. It's never been claimed."
—Libuse, Boros sergeant

cards.name: Assemble the Legion
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a muster counter on Assemble the Legion. Then put a 1/1 red and white Soldier creature token with haste onto the battlefield for each muster counter on Assemble the Legion.

cards.name: Aurelia's Fury
cards.text: Aurelia's Fury deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players. Tap each creature dealt damage this way. Players dealt damage this way can't cast noncreature spells this turn.

cards.name: Aurelia, the Warleader
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, haste
Whenever Aurelia, the Warleader attacks for the first time each turn, untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.
cards.flavor: Where Razia was aloof and untouchable, Aurelia is on the frontlines, calling for war.

cards.name: Balustrade Spy
cards.text:
Flying
When Balustrade Spy enters the battlefield, target player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card, then puts those cards into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Bane Alley Broker
cards.text:
{T}: Draw a card, then exile a card from your hand face down.
You may look at cards exiled with Bane Alley Broker.
{U}{B}, {T}: Return a card exiled with Bane Alley Broker to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Basilica Guards
cards.text:
Defender
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: "None may pass . . . for free."

cards.name: Basilica Screecher
cards.text:
Flying
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: A screech in the night is all it takes for Orzhov debtors to clutch at their coin purses.

cards.name: Beckon Apparition
cards.text: Exile target card from a graveyard. Put a 1/1 white and black Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The foyer is littered with the coins it demands but can no longer hold.

cards.name: Biomass Mutation
cards.text: Creatures you control become X/X until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"A regression to ancient forms? A glimpse of future evolutions? Or a fleeting alteration of the present?"
—Vorel of the Hull Clade

cards.name: Bioshift
cards.text: Move any number of +1/+1 counters from target creature onto another target creature with the same controller.
cards.flavor:
"It's all right if you change your mind. There's always a chance we can rearrange parts later."
—Zija, Simic mutationist

cards.name: Biovisionary
cards.text: At the beginning of the end step, if you control four or more creatures named Biovisionary, you win the game.
cards.flavor: He tired of his fellow researchers and their useless prattling, so he decided to make a network of scholars with whom he could carry a conversation.

cards.name: Blind Obedience
cards.text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Artifacts and creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: "By the time your knees have worn through your robe, you may have begun to learn your place."

cards.name: Bomber Corps
cards.text: Battalion — Whenever Bomber Corps and at least two other creatures attack, Bomber Corps deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: "Subtlety is for lawmages and spies."

cards.name: Borborygmos Enraged
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Borborygmos Enraged deals combat damage to a player, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Discard a land card: Borborygmos Enraged deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Boros Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Boros Charm deals 4 damage to target player.
• Permanents you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
• Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Practice compassion and mercy. But know when they must end."
—Aurelia

cards.name: Boros Elite
cards.text: Battalion — Whenever Boros Elite and at least two other creatures attack, Boros Elite gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"First, you must fight among the rank and file. It is there I will discern your skills as a leader."
—Aurelia, to Gideon Jura

cards.name: Boros Guildgate
cards.text:
Boros Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter with merciful hearts. Exit with battle cries.

cards.name: Boros Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
{R}{W}: Boros Keyrune becomes a 1/1 red and white Soldier artifact creature with double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Boros Reckoner
cards.text:
Whenever Boros Reckoner is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target creature or player.
{R/W}: Boros Reckoner gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Imagine a thunderstorm that's also a tactical genius. That's him."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

cards.name: Breeding Pool
cards.text:
({T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.)
As Breeding Pool enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Breeding Pool enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Uncharted depths. Unbounded hopes. Unfathomable mysteries.

cards.name: Burning-Tree Emissary
cards.text: When Burning-Tree Emissary enters the battlefield, add {R}{G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Those who regard the Gruul as savage simpletons underestimate the subtle power of their shamans.

cards.name: Burst of Strength
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature and untap it.
cards.flavor:
"Our fight is not about territory or revenge. It is about freedom, plain and simple."
—Ruric Thar, Ghor-Clan chieftain

cards.name: Call of the Nightwing
cards.text:
Put a 1/1 blue and black Horror creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Cartel Aristocrat
cards.text: Sacrifice another creature: Cartel Aristocrat gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Your life serves a higher purpose now: ensuring the continuation of my own."

cards.name: Cinder Elemental
cards.text: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"The old gods awoke and sent fingers of fire to see what was left of the old ways under the endless city."
—Daiva, Gruul storyteller

cards.name: Clan Defiance
cards.text:
Choose one or more —
• Clan Defiance deals X damage to target creature with flying.
• Clan Defiance deals X damage to target creature without flying.
• Clan Defiance deals X damage to target player.

cards.name: Clinging Anemones
cards.text:
Defender
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

cards.name: Cloudfin Raptor
cards.text:
Flying
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

cards.name: Coerced Confession
cards.text: Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. You draw a card for each creature card put into that graveyard this way.
cards.flavor:
"Ask the right questions in the right way and truth is inevitable."
—Lazav

cards.name: Consuming Aberration
cards.text:
Consuming Aberration's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your opponents' graveyards.
Whenever you cast a spell, each opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card, then puts those cards into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Contaminated Ground
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, its controller loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"No one cares about pollution until they can see it."
—Gurras, Golgari rot farmer

cards.name: Corpse Blockade
cards.text:
Defender
Sacrifice another creature: Corpse Blockade gains deathtouch until end of turn.
cards.flavor: There are laws against it, but the dead have no one to complain to and the living are too frightened to investigate.

cards.name: Court Street Denizen
cards.text: Whenever another white creature enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "The Boros fight for justice. The Azorius fight for law. I hold the line between, and make sure the people are given both."

cards.name: Crackling Perimeter
cards.text: Tap an untapped Gate you control: Crackling Perimeter deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: As the path he sought came into focus, Niv-Mizzet took steps to prevent others from approaching it.

cards.name: Crocanura
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

cards.name: Crowned Ceratok
cards.text:
Trample
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.
cards.flavor: The best way to calm a rampaging ceratok is to wait until it dies of natural causes.

cards.name: Crypt Ghast
cards.text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Whenever you tap a Swamp for mana, add {B} to your mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Daring Skyjek
cards.text: Battalion — Whenever Daring Skyjek and at least two other creatures attack, Daring Skyjek gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The hard part isn't landing in the saddle. The hard part is leaping before you see it."

cards.name: Death's Approach
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-X, where X is the number of creature cards in its controller's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"It's cold in the grave, and the dead crave your warmth. Who are you to deny them?"
—Strava, Dimir mage

cards.name: Deathcult Rogue
cards.text: Deathcult Rogue can't be blocked except by Rogues.
cards.flavor:
"The hussars can't catch him, and he evades our traps with ease. I fear he walks unseen even in the halls of New Prahv."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

cards.name: Deathpact Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Deathpact Angel dies, put a 1/1 white and black Cleric creature token onto the battlefield. It has "{3}{W}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice this creature: Return a card named Deathpact Angel from your graveyard to the battlefield."

cards.name: Debtor's Pulpit
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Tap target creature."
cards.flavor:
"You may not be able to pay. But you can still kneel."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

cards.name: Devour Flesh
cards.text: Target player sacrifices a creature, then gains life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: His twisted mind concluded that if he was what he ate, and he wanted to stay human, . . .

cards.name: Diluvian Primordial
cards.text:
Flying
When Diluvian Primordial enters the battlefield, for each opponent, you may cast up to one target instant or sorcery card from that player's graveyard without paying its mana cost. If a card cast this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Dimir Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target sorcery spell.
• Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.
• Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put one back and the rest into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Dangerous to recognize. Deadly not to."
—Lazav

cards.name: Dimir Guildgate
cards.text:
Dimir Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter and become a mastermind of spies, lies, and deception.

cards.name: Dimir Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
{U}{B}: Dimir Keyrune becomes a 2/2 blue and black Horror artifact creature until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: A key that slips through every lock.

cards.name: Dinrova Horror
cards.text: When Dinrova Horror enters the battlefield, return target permanent to its owner's hand, then that player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Welcome to the Dimir Public Offices. Not responsible for death or loss of property. Basement off-limits."
—Sign outside Dinrova Building

cards.name: Disciple of the Old Ways
cards.text: {R}: Disciple of the Old Ways gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Selesnya thinks nature is a pretty plaything. True nature would rip their faces off and wear their skins as trophies."

cards.name: Domri Rade
cards.text:
+1: Look at the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.
−2: Target creature you control fights another target creature.
−7: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control have double strike, trample, hexproof, and haste."

cards.name: Drakewing Krasis
cards.text: Flying, trample
cards.flavor: Cautious not to repeat Vig's mistakes, the Simic fuse life essences using magic alone. Each result is called a krasis.

cards.name: Duskmantle Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{U}{B}: Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere this turn, that player loses 1 life.
{2}{U}{B}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Duskmantle Seer
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of his or her library, loses life equal to that card's converted mana cost, then puts it into his or her hand.

cards.name: Dutiful Thrull
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Dutiful Thrull.
cards.flavor:
"They are useful, but there's little satisfaction in supplication that throws itself under your heel."
—Jozica, Orzhov enforcer

cards.name: Dying Wish
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature dies, target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is its power.
cards.flavor: "I wish I could rewrite my every deed and kill you with my first breath instead of my last."

cards.name: Elusive Krasis
cards.text:
Elusive Krasis can't be blocked.
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

cards.name: Ember Beast
cards.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor: The only livestock that will survive for long in the Smelting District, ember beasts serve many functions—none of them willingly.

cards.name: Enter the Infinite
cards.text: Draw cards equal to the number of cards in your library, then put a card from your hand on top of your library. You have no maximum hand size until your next turn.
cards.flavor:
"Don't just have an idea—have all of them."
—Niv-Mizzet

cards.name: Executioner's Swing
cards.text: Target creature that dealt damage this turn gets -5/-5 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The contract specified an appendage for a missed payment. Read the fine print: the head is an appendage."

cards.name: Experiment One
cards.text:
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Experiment One: Regenerate Experiment One.

cards.name: Fathom Mage
cards.text:
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
Whenever a +1/+1 counter is placed on Fathom Mage, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Firefist Striker
cards.text: Battalion — Whenever Firefist Striker and at least two other creatures attack, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: The flaming fist of Boros holds the promise of both protection and destruction in its grasp.

cards.name: Firemane Avenger
cards.text:
Flying
Battalion — Whenever Firemane Avenger and at least two other creatures attack, Firemane Avenger deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Firemane Nevena led the victorious assault on the Barbu Rooftop rebels. Now the Gateless have marked her for death.

cards.name: Five-Alarm Fire
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, put a blaze counter on Five-Alarm Fire.
Remove five blaze counters from Five-Alarm Fire: Five-Alarm Fire deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Forced Adaptation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"We're planting the seeds of change. Sometimes, we plant them in people."
—Vorel of the Hull Clade

cards.name: Fortress Cyclops
cards.text:
Whenever Fortress Cyclops attacks, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
Whenever Fortress Cyclops blocks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They think they tamed him, but he will always be a wild titan, a force of nature."
—Nedja, Gruul shaman

cards.name: Foundry Champion
cards.text:
When Foundry Champion enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of creatures you control.
{R}: Foundry Champion gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{W}: Foundry Champion gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Foundry Street Denizen
cards.text: Whenever another red creature enters the battlefield under your control, Foundry Street Denizen gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: After the Foundry Street riot, Arrester Hulbein tried to ban bludgeons. Which, inevitably, resulted in another riot.

cards.name: Frenzied Tilling
cards.text: Destroy target land. Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Izzet contraptions pollute our lands. Burn them down, kill the makers, cleanse the earth."
—Nedja, Gruul shaman

cards.name: Frilled Oculus
cards.text: {1}{G}: Frilled Oculus gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"Understand the Simic? That's about as easy as winning a staring contest with a homunculus."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

cards.name: Frontline Medic
cards.text:
Battalion — Whenever Frontline Medic and at least two other creatures attack, creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
Sacrifice Frontline Medic: Counter target spell with {X} in its mana cost unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.name: Furious Resistance
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"At least the Gateless rebels have ideals. Rakdos just mocks, defiles, and kills all we hold dear."
—Libuse, Boros sergeant

cards.name: Gateway Shade
cards.text:
{B}: Gateway Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Tap an untapped Gate you control: Gateway Shade gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Tireless and merciless, shades are harnessed as spies by the Dimir.

cards.name: Ghor-Clan Rampager
cards.text:
Trample
Bloodrush — {R}{G}, Discard Ghor-Clan Rampager: Target attacking creature gets +4/+4 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Simic come from the cold slow depths. How could they understand the fire in a wild heart?"
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman

cards.name: Giant Adephage
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Giant Adephage deals combat damage to a player, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of Giant Adephage.
cards.flavor:
"To a creature like that, we must seem like, well, bugs."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

cards.name: Gideon, Champion of Justice
cards.text:
+1: Put a loyalty counter on Gideon, Champion of Justice for each creature target opponent controls.
0: Until end of turn, Gideon, Champion of Justice becomes a Human Soldier creature with power and toughness each equal to the number of loyalty counters on him and gains indestructible. He's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.
−15: Exile all other permanents.

cards.name: Gift of Orzhova
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying and lifelink.
cards.flavor:
"Remember by whose gift you ascend."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

cards.name: Glaring Spotlight
cards.text:
Creatures your opponents control with hexproof can be the targets of spells and abilities you control as though they didn't have hexproof.
{3}, Sacrifice Glaring Spotlight: Creatures you control gain hexproof until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Godless Shrine
cards.text:
({T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.)
As Godless Shrine enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Godless Shrine enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Judgment without hope.

cards.name: Greenside Watcher
cards.text: {T}: Untap target Gate.
cards.flavor: "The Izzet may incite war, but my duty is here. I will not abandon the wild."

cards.name: Gridlock
cards.text: Tap X target nonland permanents.
cards.flavor:
"One tiny peg pulled from a single wagon wheel, and an entire district grinds to a halt."
—Lazav

cards.name: Grisly Spectacle
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact creature. Its controller puts a number of cards equal to that creature's power from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Watch people flock to a murder scene. Then tell me we're not all a little sick in the head."
—Juri, proprietor of the Juri Revue

cards.name: Ground Assault
cards.text: Ground Assault deals damage to target creature equal to the number of lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Taking down a dragon is easy. All you need is enough space to get in a good swing."
—Narbulg Nine Fingers

cards.name: Gruul Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
• Gain control of all permanents you own.
• Gruul Charm deals 3 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Not Gruul? Then die!"
—Borborygmos

cards.name: Gruul Guildgate
cards.text:
Gruul Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter and leave the shackles of society behind.

cards.name: Gruul Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
{R}{G}: Gruul Keyrune becomes a 3/2 red and green Beast artifact creature with trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As perilous and unpredictable as the wilds themselves.

cards.name: Gruul Ragebeast
cards.text: Whenever Gruul Ragebeast or another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature fights target creature an opponent controls.
cards.flavor:
"If the other guilds want a war, they should know we've been ready the whole time."
—Ruric Thar, Ghor-Clan chieftain

cards.name: Guardian of the Gateless
cards.text:
Flying
Guardian of the Gateless can block any number of creatures.
Whenever Guardian of the Gateless blocks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature it's blocking.

cards.name: Guildscorn Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from multicolored.
cards.flavor:
"The Gateless have risen. The Ten shall fall."
—Ninth District graffiti

cards.name: Gutter Skulk
cards.flavor: Upon finding his warehouse infested, Gaven didn't know whether to get an exterminator or an exorcist.

cards.name: Gyre Sage
cards.text:
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each +1/+1 counter on Gyre Sage.

cards.name: Hands of Binding
cards.text:
Tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Hellkite Tyrant
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever Hellkite Tyrant deals combat damage to a player, gain control of all artifacts that player controls.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control twenty or more artifacts, you win the game.

cards.name: Hellraiser Goblin
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste and attack each combat if able.
cards.flavor: Don't let him lead the soldiers, but by all means let him lead the way.

cards.name: High Priest of Penance
cards.text: Whenever High Priest of Penance is dealt damage, you may destroy target nonland permanent.
cards.flavor: "All I require is faith, loyalty, obedience, trust, and complete and utter devotion."

cards.name: Hindervines
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures with no +1/+1 counters on them.
cards.flavor:
"Woodlands and laws. Both grow faster than the Azorius's ability to manage them."
—Suniel the Woodwise

cards.name: Hold the Gates
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+1 for each Gate you control and have vigilance.
cards.flavor: "We grew up on these streets. We know them better than any Boros grunt from Zelzo."

cards.name: Holy Mantle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has protection from creatures.
cards.flavor:
"The guilds promise to provide safety. I prefer to make my own."
—Briska, Ninth District freemage

cards.name: Homing Lightning
cards.text: Homing Lightning deals 4 damage to target creature and each other creature with the same name as that creature.
cards.flavor:
"I see countless worlds. What makes them think I can't find them in just one?"
—Ral Zarek

cards.name: Horror of the Dim
cards.text: {U}: Horror of the Dim gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor:
"Lesser minds can scarcely imagine such a marriage of necromancy and mind magic."
—Strava, Dimir mage

cards.name: Hydroform
cards.text: Target land becomes a 3/3 Elemental creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.
cards.flavor:
"While the sea may be our home, the sky is our destiny."
—Prime Speaker Zegana

cards.name: Illness in the Ranks
cards.text: Creature tokens get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"Selesnya denied us tribute. Let's show them the error of their ways."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

cards.name: Illusionist's Bracers
cards.text:
Whenever an ability of equipped creature is activated, if it isn't a mana ability, copy that ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.
Equip {3}
cards.flavor: It's easy to believe you're a god when you're twice as powerful as everyone else.

cards.name: Immortal Servitude
cards.text: Return each creature card with converted mana cost X from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"The fine print of countless contracts has ensured we are never defenseless."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

cards.name: Incursion Specialist
cards.text: Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, Incursion Specialist gets +2/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "Work for the Dimir again? That depends. Tell me more about this maze."

cards.name: Ivy Lane Denizen
cards.text: Whenever another green creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: "Skyknight gear? Well, I have drake-skin gauntlets, supple and fireproof. Or a ceratok chestplate that'll stop a crossbow bolt."

cards.name: Keymaster Rogue
cards.text:
Keymaster Rogue can't be blocked.
When Keymaster Rogue enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "This one opens the grate outside Zelzo Base. This one is for Ismeri Library. This one is for an invisible door . . . No, I've said too much."

cards.name: Killing Glare
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power X or less.
cards.flavor: A casual glance into a dark corner may be your last.

cards.name: Kingpin's Pet
cards.text:
Flying
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
cards.flavor:
"Debt and death sound so similar, and thrulls are so hard of hearing. Mistakes are inevitable."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

cards.name: Knight of Obligation
cards.text:
Vigilance
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: He can calculate interest to six decimal places even in the midst of a deadly duel.

cards.name: Knight Watch
cards.text: Put two 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with vigilance onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"We lost respect after the battle for Barbu Rooftop. Send the troops to mingle respectfully with the citizens."
—Commander Yaszen of Boros

cards.name: Last Thoughts
cards.text:
Draw a card.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Lazav, Dimir Mastermind
cards.text:
Hexproof
Whenever a creature card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may have Lazav, Dimir Mastermind become a copy of that card except its name is still Lazav, Dimir Mastermind, it's legendary in addition to its other types, and it gains hexproof and this ability.

cards.name: Legion Loyalist
cards.text:
Haste
Battalion — Whenever Legion Loyalist and at least two other creatures attack, creatures you control gain first strike and trample until end of turn and can't be blocked by creature tokens this turn.

cards.name: Leyline Phantom
cards.text: When Leyline Phantom deals combat damage, return it to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it survived combat.)
cards.flavor:
"Is the maze itself a phantom? Or is one as real as the other? Perhaps I am as mad as the dragon."
—Jace Beleren, journal

cards.name: Lord of the Void
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Lord of the Void deals combat damage to a player, exile the top seven cards of that player's library, then put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Luminate Primordial
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Luminate Primordial enters the battlefield, for each opponent, exile up to one target creature that player controls and that player gains life equal to its power.

cards.name: Madcap Skills
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor: The larger the crowd, the harder it is for them to run away.

cards.name: Mark for Death
cards.text: Target creature an opponent controls blocks this turn if able. Untap that creature. Other creatures that player controls can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Everyone roots for the little guy, but nobody bets on him.

cards.name: Martial Glory
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
Target creature gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, Boros tactics are unparalleled. But when your comrades are dying around you, inner strength must carry the day."
—Gideon Jura, to Aurelia

cards.name: Massive Raid
cards.text: Massive Raid deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"The Boros lack vision. Give them a convenient scapegoat and they'll be blind to the true threats."
—Lazav

cards.name: Master Biomancer
cards.text: Each other creature you control enters the battlefield with a number of additional +1/+1 counters on it equal to Master Biomancer's power and as a Mutant in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor: "Nature is a wonderful engineer but works far too slowly for my tastes."

cards.name: Mental Vapors
cards.text:
Target player discards a card.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Merciless Eviction
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Exile all artifacts.
• Exile all creatures.
• Exile all enchantments.
• Exile all planeswalkers.
cards.flavor:
"I once saw the Obzedat moved to action. Since that day, I've been thankful that they're mainly lazy, and dead."
—Aurelia, to Gideon Jura

cards.name: Merfolk of the Depths
cards.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
cards.flavor: When giant sinkholes opened across Ravnica, they revealed buried oceans and the merfolk, once thought to be extinct.

cards.name: Metropolis Sprite
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Metropolis Sprite gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Well, if that goblin didn't want his tongue pierced, he shouldn't have stuck it out at me."

cards.name: Midnight Recovery
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Millennial Gargoyle
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"You've got to keep your wits about you on the roofs. Not all stones are compliant handholds."
—Iveta, rooftop runner

cards.name: Miming Slime
cards.text: Put an X/X green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"We paid the Simic very well for this capability, but we should quickly recoup our expenses in saved wages."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

cards.name: Mind Grind
cards.text: Each opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals X land cards, then puts all cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard. X can't be 0.

cards.name: Mindeye Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Mindeye Drake dies, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: They can map both the cityscape and the minds of its architects.

cards.name: Molten Primordial
cards.text:
Haste
When Molten Primordial enters the battlefield, for each opponent, gain control of up to one target creature that player controls until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Mortus Strider
cards.text: When Mortus Strider dies, return it to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Dimir's best agents hide from death itself.

cards.name: Mugging
cards.text: Mugging deals 2 damage to target creature. That creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Scream: muffled. Pockets: emptied. Neck function: never the same again.

cards.name: Murder Investigation
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature dies, put X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is its power.
cards.flavor: "Every death has a web of consequences. Our job is to find the spider."

cards.name: Mystic Genesis
cards.text: Counter target spell. Put an X/X green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"The Simic can grow anything out of a puddle of sludge. I just hope they never join forces with the Golgari."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"And if you threaten me again, your shiny steel trousers will be sprouting daggerthorn vines."
—Iveta, rooftop runner

cards.name: Nav Squad Commandos
cards.text: Battalion — Whenever Nav Squad Commandos and at least two other creatures attack, Nav Squad Commandos gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Untap it.
cards.flavor: Funded by the Azorius to keep current maps of the undercity, the Boros nav squads survey even the most unsavory areas.

cards.name: Nightveil Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Nightveil Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.
You may play cards exiled with Nightveil Specter.

cards.name: Nimbus Swimmer
cards.text:
Flying
Nimbus Swimmer enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: The Simic soon discovered that the sky offered as few constraints on size as the sea.

cards.name: Obzedat, Ghost Council
cards.text:
When Obzedat, Ghost Council enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
At the beginning of your end step, you may exile Obzedat. If you do, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of your next upkeep. It gains haste.

cards.name: Ogre Slumlord
cards.text:
Whenever another nontoken creature dies, you may put a 1/1 black Rat creature token onto the battlefield.
Rats you control have deathtouch.
cards.flavor:
"His tenement is filled with the most vile, disgusting vermin. It's infested with rats, too."
—Branko One-Ear

cards.name: One Thousand Lashes
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Ooze Flux
cards.text: {1}{G}, Remove one or more +1/+1 counters from among creatures you control: Put an X/X green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters removed this way.

cards.name: Ordruun Veteran
cards.text: Battalion — Whenever Ordruun Veteran and at least two other creatures attack, Ordruun Veteran gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor: "My father was Gruul, but I chose the precision of the legion over the fury of the pack."

cards.name: Orzhov Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature you control and all Auras you control attached to it to their owner's hand.
• Destroy target creature and you lose life equal to its toughness.
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Orzhov Guildgate
cards.text:
Orzhov Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter to find wealth, security, and eternal life . . . for just a small price up front.

cards.name: Orzhov Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.
{W}{B}: Orzhov Keyrune becomes a 1/4 white and black Thrull artifact creature with lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor: You only need to wield it once to appreciate the power of control.

cards.name: Paranoid Delusions
cards.text:
Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Pit Fight
cards.text: Target creature you control fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor:
"All the coins in Ravnica can't save his soul now."
—Narbulg Nine Fingers

cards.name: Predator's Rapport
cards.text: Choose target creature you control. You gain life equal to that creature's power plus its toughness.
cards.flavor:
"Other guilds say the Gruul are savages, no better than the beasts we live with. I say we've found friends who won't stab us in the back."
—Domri Rade

cards.name: Primal Visitation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has haste.
cards.flavor: Gruul shamans believe all sentient beings have the soul of savagery inside them, an animal form clawing to escape.

cards.name: Prime Speaker Zegana
cards.text:
Prime Speaker Zegana enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the greatest power among other creatures you control.
When Prime Speaker Zegana enters the battlefield, draw cards equal to its power.

cards.name: Prophetic Prism
cards.text:
When Prophetic Prism enters the battlefield, draw a card.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: To understand Ravnica, one must first understand how each guild contributes to its stability.

cards.name: Psychic Strike
cards.text: Counter target spell. Its controller puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: Until more information could be gleaned about Niv-Mizzet's intentions, Lazav took every opportunity to stall his experiments.

cards.name: Purge the Profane
cards.text: Target opponent discards two cards and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: The Orzhov hear the plans of the other guilds through the guilty thoughts of the disloyal.

cards.name: Rapid Hybridization
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller puts a 3/3 green Frog Lizard creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"We've merged your life essence with that of several creatures at once. You're welcome."
—Speaker Trifon

cards.name: Razortip Whip
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Razortip Whip deals 1 damage to target opponent.
cards.flavor:
"It no longer surprises me what shows up in our raid of a Rakdos revue."
—Janik Bara, Wojek captain

cards.name: Realmwright
cards.text:
As Realmwright enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Lands you control are the chosen type in addition to their other types.
cards.flavor: There is not a single inch of Ravnica that hasn't been altered at one point or another to fit someone's whims.

cards.name: Righteous Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "In the name of peace, moderation, and decency—wipe them all out!"

cards.name: Riot Gear
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: Any meeting between guilds requires proper equipment.

cards.name: Ripscale Predator
cards.text: Ripscale Predator can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor: As Ravnica's wilds expanded, even advocates for nature had to confront fiercer natural threats.

cards.name: Rubblebelt Raiders
cards.text: Whenever Rubblebelt Raiders attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each attacking creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"This city will perish, and the Gruul will cheer as the boar-god crushes the last bricks into dust."
—Nikya of the Old Ways

cards.name: Rubblehulk
cards.text:
Rubblehulk's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
Bloodrush — {1}{R}{G}, Discard Rubblehulk: Target attacking creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Ruination Wurm
cards.flavor: When the architects of Ravnica claim a structure will stand against a wurm, they never mention for how long.

cards.name: Rust Scarab
cards.text: Whenever Rust Scarab becomes blocked, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment defending player controls.
cards.flavor:
"Behold nature's answer to the problem of society."
—Nikya of the Old Ways

cards.name: Sacred Foundry
cards.text:
({T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.)
As Sacred Foundry enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Sacred Foundry enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Burning fervor and fearsome skill create a lethal beauty terrible to behold.

cards.name: Sage's Row Denizen
cards.text: Whenever another blue creature enters the battlefield under your control, target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: "I offer you wisdom untainted by false loyalty, learning free of any guild's agenda."

cards.name: Sapphire Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has flying.
cards.flavor: Sapphire drakes can communicate over great distances, their calls resonating in the gems fixed in their skulls.

cards.name: Scab-Clan Charger
cards.text: Bloodrush — {1}{G}, Discard Scab-Clan Charger: Target attacking creature gets +2/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The only roads I wish to see are those beaten flat by wild hooves."

cards.name: Scatter Arc
cards.text:
Counter target noncreature spell.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Should your chosen emissary be able to fluctuate triharmonic pentodes, however unlikely, I shall shunt excess negavolt radicals."

cards.name: Scorchwalker
cards.text: Bloodrush — {1}{R}{R}, Discard Scorchwalker: Target attacking creature gets +5/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Borborygmos's elemental launched an assault, but the Izzet wards held and experiments continue."
—Skyknight report on the Rubblebelt

cards.name: Sepulchral Primordial
cards.text:
Intimidate
When Sepulchral Primordial enters the battlefield, for each opponent, you may put up to one target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Serene Remembrance
cards.text: Shuffle Serene Remembrance and up to three target cards from a single graveyard into their owners' libraries.
cards.flavor: While Lazav schemed and Niv-Mizzet researched, Trostani sought the future in the whispers of the past.

cards.name: Shadow Alley Denizen
cards.text: Whenever another black creature enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.name: Shadow Slice
cards.text:
Target opponent loses 3 life.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Shambleshark
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

cards.name: Shattering Blow
cards.text: Exile target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Aurelia seems too eager to solve her problems by delivering them to oblivion."
—Prime Speaker Zegana

cards.name: Shielded Passage
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Izzet delved into the depths of Ravnica's past, and Selesnya followed without fear.

cards.name: Signal the Clans
cards.text: Search your library for three creature cards and reveal them. If you reveal three cards with different names, choose one of them at random and put that card into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your library.
cards.flavor: Gruul clanfolk obey few rules, but all feel bound to answer the call of the horn.

cards.name: Simic Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
• Permanents you control gain hexproof until end of turn.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"We measure our progress in heartbeats."
—Prime Speaker Zegana

cards.name: Simic Fluxmage
cards.text:
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
{1}{U}, {T}: Move a +1/+1 counter from Simic Fluxmage onto target creature.

cards.name: Simic Guildgate
cards.text:
Simic Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter and comprehend the perfection of orchestrated life.

cards.name: Simic Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.
{G}{U}: Simic Keyrune becomes a 2/3 green and blue Crab artifact creature with hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Simic Manipulator
cards.text:
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
{T}, Remove one or more +1/+1 counters from Simic Manipulator: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of +1/+1 counters removed this way.

cards.name: Skarrg Goliath
cards.text:
Trample
Bloodrush — {5}{G}{G}, Discard Skarrg Goliath: Target attacking creature gets +9/+9 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They bind us with their laws. We free ourselves with nature's fist."
—Nikya of the Old Ways

cards.name: Skarrg Guildmage
cards.text:
{R}{G}: Creatures you control gain trample until end of turn.
{1}{R}{G}: Target land you control becomes a 4/4 Elemental creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

cards.name: Skinbrand Goblin
cards.text: Bloodrush — {R}, Discard Skinbrand Goblin: Target attacking creature gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"These Gruul skin-runes—discern whether their patterns evoke streets, leylines, or both. You have four days."
—Niv-Mizzet, to his assistant

cards.name: Skullcrack
cards.text: Players can't gain life this turn. Damage can't be prevented this turn. Skullcrack deals 3 damage to target player.
cards.flavor: The lawmage's argument was clever and well reasoned, but Blunk's response proved irrefutable.

cards.name: Skyblinder Staff
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: "If bats are the only thing between me and a mountain of Orzhov coins, then I'm about to be a very rich thief."

cards.name: Skygames
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery."
cards.flavor: Both Boros and Azorius scout the games in hopes of recruiting the finest athletes.

cards.name: Skyknight Legionnaire
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor: Millennium Platform, once a monument to peace, was quickly seized by the skyknights for its strategic aerial location.

cards.name: Slate Street Ruffian
cards.text: Whenever Slate Street Ruffian becomes blocked, defending player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Merciless to the point of psychosis. Let's give him a job."
—Zelinas, Orzhov recruiter

cards.name: Slaughterhorn
cards.text: Bloodrush — {G}, Discard Slaughterhorn: Target attacking creature gets +3/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Orzhov clergy would never cross its path, but sending thrull couriers to do so is cheap and entertaining.

cards.name: Smite
cards.text: Destroy target blocked creature.
cards.flavor:
"Sure, today of all days, he asked to borrow my boots!"
—Darijo, Ivy Street ruffian

cards.name: Smog Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
Creatures with flying your opponents control get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"The skies used to be my refuge, a place of peace away from the chaos below. Now, with every flight, death seems to follow me like a shadow."
—Writings of Cica, Skyjek scout

cards.name: Soul Ransom
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Discard two cards: Soul Ransom's controller sacrifices it, then draws two cards. Only any opponent may activate this ability.

cards.name: Spark Trooper
cards.text:
Trample, lifelink, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Spark Trooper.
cards.flavor: Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome charge empty sets of armor that give form to the fluctuating elementals.

cards.name: Spell Rupture
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"Like water, mana will drain from an inferior vessel."
—Jalan Tosk, Simic forcemage

cards.name: Spire Tracer
cards.text: Spire Tracer can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
cards.flavor: Cartographers on Ravnica chart not just the horizontal, but also the vertical.

cards.name: Stolen Identity
cards.text:
Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of target artifact or creature.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Stomping Ground
cards.text:
({T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.)
As Stomping Ground enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Stomping Ground enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Roots, ruins, and room to fight. All the comforts of home."
—Domri Rade

cards.name: Structural Collapse
cards.text: Target player sacrifices an artifact and a land. Structural Collapse deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: The Gruul holiday of Rauck-Chauv always ends the same way.

cards.name: Sunhome Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{R}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
{2}{R}{W}: Put a 1/1 red and white Soldier creature token with haste onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Sylvan Primordial
cards.text:
Reach
When Sylvan Primordial enters the battlefield, for each opponent, destroy target noncreature permanent that player controls. For each permanent destroyed this way, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Syndic of Tithes
cards.text: Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
cards.flavor:
"Entrance is free. Donations are required."
—Notice outside Vizkopa Bank

cards.name: Syndicate Enforcer
cards.text: Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: Even the darkest corners of Ravnica still lie in the shadow of the Church.

cards.name: Thespian's Stage
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Thespian's Stage becomes a copy of target land and gains this ability.
cards.flavor: Amid rumors of war, the third act of The Absolution of the Guildpact was quickly rewritten as a tragedy.

cards.name: Thrull Parasite
cards.text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
{T}, Pay 2 life: Remove a counter from target nonland permanent.
cards.flavor: The hunger of a vampire and the subtlety of a tax collector.

cards.name: Tin Street Market
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card."
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes I stroll along Tin Street and watch citizens busy with their daily lives. It reminds me why I do my job."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

cards.name: Totally Lost
cards.text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Fblthp had always hated crowds.

cards.name: Tower Defense
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+5 and gain reach until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The drakes are practice. We may one day need to bring down a sky swallower, or maybe even Rakdos himself."
—Korun Nar, Rubblebelt hunter

cards.name: Towering Thunderfist
cards.text: {W}: Towering Thunderfist gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Nothing ruins a party like one of those big killjoys bursting through the door and setting all the guests free."
—Ruba, Rakdos cultist

cards.name: Treasury Thrull
cards.text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Whenever Treasury Thrull attacks, you may return target artifact, creature, or enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Truefire Paladin
cards.text:
Vigilance
{R}{W}: Truefire Paladin gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{R}{W}: Truefire Paladin gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Undercity Informer
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card, then puts those cards into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Scandal and slander are never welcome news. That's why I'm never the messenger."

cards.name: Undercity Plague
cards.text:
Target player loses 1 life, discards a card, then sacrifices a permanent.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Unexpected Results
cards.text: Shuffle your library, then reveal the top card. If it's a nonland card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield and return Unexpected Results to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Urban Evolution
cards.text: Draw three cards. You may play an additional land this turn.
cards.flavor: As the Simic released more of their krasis experiments, they required new habitats, always at the expense of the locals.

cards.name: Urbis Protector
cards.text: When Urbis Protector enters the battlefield, put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"I hear that Boros is losing its angels to the Gateless Movement. I'm sure this comes as no surprise to you."
—Teysa, to Lazav

cards.name: Verdant Haven
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Verdant Haven enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Viashino Shanktail
cards.text:
First strike
Bloodrush — {2}{R}, Discard Viashino Shanktail: Target attacking creature gets +3/+1 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Slizt Clan's battle cry is an impressive display of fury, defiance, and spit.

cards.name: Vizkopa Confessor
cards.text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
When Vizkopa Confessor enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life. Target opponent reveals that many cards from his or her hand. You choose one of them and exile it.

cards.name: Vizkopa Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{W}{B}: Target creature gains lifelink until end of turn.
{1}{W}{B}: Whenever you gain life this turn, each opponent loses that much life.

cards.name: Voidwalk
cards.text:
Exile target creature. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Warmind Infantry
cards.text: Battalion — Whenever Warmind Infantry and at least two other creatures attack, Warmind Infantry gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Before Aurelia denounced Niv-Mizzet, the two guilds had collaborated on the Warmind Initiative in pursuit of the ultimate soldier.

cards.name: Wasteland Viper
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Bloodrush — {G}, Discard Wasteland Viper: Target attacking creature gets +1/+2 and gains deathtouch until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Gruul embrace all things poisonous and living in the cracks of society."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

cards.name: Watery Grave
cards.text:
({T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.)
As Watery Grave enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Watery Grave enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"I fear that as we scurry after phantoms, the Dimir pull nine puppet strings."
—Ral Zarek

cards.name: Way of the Thief
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Enchanted creature can't be blocked as long as you control a Gate.
cards.flavor: A true shortcut isn't a way other people don't know; it's a way other people can't go.

cards.name: Whispering Madness
cards.text:
Each player discards his or her hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Wight of Precinct Six
cards.text: Wight of Precinct Six gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your opponents' graveyards.
cards.flavor: Even the lost and undead need a protector.

cards.name: Wildwood Rebirth
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: In Ravnica, there are maladies far more difficult to treat than death.

cards.name: Wojek Halberdiers
cards.text: Battalion — Whenever Wojek Halberdiers and at least two other creatures attack, Wojek Halberdiers gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Tired of Boros interference, the Rakdos unleashed hellraiser goblins, hoping their corpses would weigh down the halberds.

cards.name: Wrecking Ogre
cards.text:
Double strike
Bloodrush — {3}{R}{R}, Discard Wrecking Ogre: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 and gains double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If no opponent can be found, ogres of the Bolrac Clan will often pick fights with buildings.

cards.name: Zameck Guildmage
cards.text:
{G}{U}: This turn, each creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
{G}{U}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Draw a card.

cards.name: Zarichi Tiger
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}: You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"The taming and consecration of these creatures is evidence of our faith."
—Resimir, Zarichi Temple priest

cards.name: Zhur-Taa Swine
cards.text: Bloodrush — {1}{R}{G}, Discard Zhur-Taa Swine: Target attacking creature gets +5/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Gurley was the first to domesticate one, though his widow didn't take much solace in that accomplishment.
